alert.note: Alert for Cedar; Delaware; Jones; Linn (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 3:15AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Cedar, Jones, south central Delaware and Linn Counties through 400 AM CDT... At 314 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Hopkinton to Waubeek to Shellsburg. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. Torrential rainfall with amounts over 1 inch in 30 to 45 minutes. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cedar Rapids, Anamosa, Mechanicsville, Marion, Hiawatha, Mount Vernon, Monticello, Robins, Lisbon, Ely, Central City, Springville, Walker, Olin, Alburnett, Coggon, Wyoming, Oxford Junction, Bertram and Martelle. This includes Interstate 380 between mile markers 19 and 33. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
